title: Dinosaur robot greets guests at Japanese robot hotel (VIDEO)
text:
Dinosaur robot greets guests at Japanese robot hotel (VIDEO) Friday July 17, 2015 Print Article 
TOKYO, July 17 — Japan’s Henn na Hotel, which translates as ‘weird hotel’ in English, has some pretty unusual employees. 
It’s run almost entirely by robots. There’s a robot that checks you in, a dinosaur bot concierge and even a robot that carries your bags to your room. 
Hideo Sawada is behind the new hospitality venture opening at a Japanese amusement park. 
He said, “Of course these robots cannot just replace all human labour, but in terms of being friendly and polite, they are unbeatable. That’s why I asked developers to make robots for this hotel.” 
In addition to the robots, the hotel has lots of high tech features. 
A facial recognition system lets you into your room, and this little tulip-shaped robot responds to commands to set alarms or adjust lights. And check out the radiation panels — they automatically detect body heat and adjust room temperature accordingly. 
Low staff costs and solar energy power help keep room rates to a moderate ¥7,000 (RM214), which is just US$56 (RM212) per night. 
Sawada said, “I think low-cost hotels will become a trend just as low-cost airlines did. This is the first attempt toward that.” 
If all goes well, the ‘Weird’ Hotel, may just turn out to be the future for budget lodging. — Reuters
